hook.text: In the 1930s, walls of dust 10,000 feet high swept across the Great Plains.

buildup.text: WWI wheat prices drove farmers to plow millions of acres of grassland.

twist.text: 2.5 million people fled the Plains. 'Okies' migrated to California, where they were met with hostility and exploitation.

climax.text: The Dust Bowl showed that markets without environmental guardrails can destroy the natural capital on which all.

punchline.text: The market said: grow more wheat. Nature said: I quit.

quiz.question: What was the economic cause of the Dust Bowl?
options: Market incentives drove farmers to over-plow grassland, destroying topsoil with no environmental protections
